intro: Hieracium stenstroemii, commonly known as the Stenströms hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Scandinavia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly habitats, often in alpine or subalpine regions. It has hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and flies.
